Review.Titre: I used to be able to renew a 650 minute…
Review.Contenu: I used to be able to renew a 650 minute monthly plan earlier than the renew date if I ran out of minutes… this adjusted the renewal date and I did this up until this last time. My minutes expired and I wanted to renew the plan as of yesterday but it did not so what it normally allowed me to do. I messaged the support and they told me that it will automatically renew on the 6th of November. I asked if I could cancel the plan an resubscribe but they didn’t get back to so I went and cancelled the expired plan. When I went to subscribe for the plan again, that one is no longer available as I was told after I reported the issue because I wanted to reverse my cancellation within minutes of finding out that this plan was NLA!!! I have used Keepcalling for several years now, but since this last rate increase, it appears that customer service has gone out the window. I have received notification of other plans that are costing up to half the price but I usually am a loyal person to what I subscribe to. Due to NO attempt to resolve this issue has been apparent, I am questioning what their protocol is at handling any issues at all??? 😱😱😟😟The point that I was making is that if I would have been told to wait until November 6th to renew the 650 plan, then the plan would have still been available… unless you are saying that even on the 6th of November I would have been told that it would not auto renew.I should have been advised that this plan would no longer be available if that was the case.

I called to cheer my uncle at his 75 yr annyversary. We managed to exchange basic information but that is it. VERY disappointing. The previous provider never had any problem with connection. So, I know that the problems with connection are due to specifics of KeepCalling. I'll continue looking for another provider.

The reason why it became zero $ was they charged twice rate of local access number call for 800 access number. I knew I pay some fee for using 800 line use but never knew double charge for that. Review.Titre: Decent Call Quality...but...
Review.Contenu: In general the call quality is acceptable but that is not soley dependent on their service as your internet connection need to have a decent signal.  That being said, there is something that is specific to their service that has made me search for alternatives.  Many of my international calls to the USA are to companies where wait times can exceed 20 minutes.  I have experienced on multiple occasions being dropped after on hold for anywhere from 18-22 minutes.  Then I lose my queue and have to start over.  Aside from the frustration, I have lost those call minute credits.  I have used my G-Voice and another app and never had this experience.  But 75% of the time I exceed 18 minutes holding I get dropped by KeepCalling.Regarding response from KeepCalling, of course I implemented all their suggestions. I even tried a few of my own corrective measures given I’m technologically adept. Unfortunately, results were the same. Dropped calls after 18-22 minutes.

Review.Titre: Unable to recharge from app reply update
Review.Contenu: It would be nice to recharge my account from the mobile app when Iwant to recharge, like other service providers. There seems to be a very big push to use auto recharge. Good to have this option but not good to be the only option.Reply:Thanks for responding to my review.I understand there are other ways to recharge my credit. I am using the latest IOS software. It is unfortunate that, due to Apple’s policies, Keep Calling have no option to add Voice Credit directly from the KeepCalling App, as you state in your reply. I am however able to add credit directly from the Toolani App using the same phone with the same IOS software. Perhaps Keep Calling could find out how to do this with the IOS software?I hope this information helps.

What I don't like is the fact that the rates had gone up (for the country I call) a lot, from 12 cents/minute to 17 cents/minute if you call a landline, and from 25 cents/minute to 40 cents/minute if you call a cellphone. As you can see the rates had gone up significantly, and the rates only go up, they never go down.

Review.Titre: Since you have asked us to be honest…
Review.Contenu: Since you have asked us to be honest and as a consumer, permit me to say it then. The service is good and the phone calls are for the most part cleared and diligently fast. The app is okay and easy to understand. However, I wish KeepCalling would allow its customers to keep the minutes that are not used during the month period and roll them over to the next cycle. I find it abysmally troubling that unused minutes are just deleted once the month reaches its cycle.  This to me is something that I find a bit dishonest especially because those unused minutes are ours to keep. After all, we have paid for them and we should be able to keep them regardless of the cycle's terms. Just something to consider!
